SENT.plain: Nontraumatic spinal cord ischemia is uncommon, especially when the cervical cord is involved
We present an elderly man who sustained acute occlusion of the anterior spinal artery at a high cervical level
This was followed by a respiratory arrest due to the paralysis of the diaphragm and chest wall muscles
A review of the vascular supply to the cord and of nontraumatic ischemic myelopathy is provided
